output: Chest pain with shortness of breath can indicate several serious conditions including myocardial infarction (heart attack), angina, pulmonary embolism, or pneumonia. This combination of symptoms requires immediate medical evaluation. Call 911 if you experience severe chest pain, especially if accompanied by sweating, nausea, or pain radiating to the arm, jaw, or back.

input: sudden severe headache worst headache of my life
output: A sudden, severe headache described as 'the worst headache of your life' is a medical emergency that could indicate a subarachnoid hemorrhage (brain bleed), meningitis, or other serious neurological condition. This type of headache requires immediate emergency medical attention. Do not delay - call 911 or go to the emergency room immediately.

Diabetes management involves monitoring blood glucose levels, maintaining a healthy diet, regular exercise, and taking prescribed medications. Target blood glucose levels are typically 80-130 mg/dL before meals and less than 180 mg/dL after meals. HbA1c should be less than 7% for most adults. Work with your healthcare provider to develop a personalized diabetes management plan.

An asthma attack involves inflammation and narrowing of airways, causing difficulty breathing, wheezing, and chest tightness. Use your rescue inhaler (albuterol) as prescribed. If symptoms don't improve within 15-20 minutes, seek emergency medical care. Severe asthma attacks can be life-threatening and require immediate medical attention.
warning_signs: Unable to speak in full sentences

output: Severe abdominal pain with nausea and vomiting can indicate various conditions including appendicitis, gallbladder disease, bowel obstruction, or peptic ulcer disease. The location, character, and associated symptoms help determine the cause. Seek immediate medical attention if you experience severe, persistent abdominal pain, especially if accompanied by fever, rigid abdomen, or signs of dehydration.

Depression and anxiety are serious mental health conditions that can significantly impact your quality of life. Symptoms include persistent sadness, loss of interest, anxiety, and feelings of hopelessness. These conditions are treatable with therapy, medication, or a combination of both. If you're having thoughts of self-harm, please seek immediate help by calling 988 (Suicide & Crisis Lifeline) or going to your nearest emergency room.

Skin rashes with itching and red patches can result from various causes including allergic reactions, eczema, psoriasis, or infections. The appearance, location, and associated symptoms help determine the cause. Avoid scratching to prevent secondary infection. Use gentle, fragrance-free skincare products and consider antihistamines for itching. See a dermatologist if symptoms persist or worsen.

Fever with chills, body aches, and fatigue are common symptoms of viral or bacterial infections, including flu, COVID-19, or other respiratory infections. Rest, hydration, and symptomatic treatment are important. Monitor temperature and seek medical attention if fever exceeds 103°F (39.4°C), symptoms worsen, or you develop difficulty breathing or severe headache.

Joint pain with stiffness and swelling can indicate arthritis, injury, or other musculoskeletal conditions. Osteoarthritis is common with aging, while rheumatoid arthritis is an autoimmune condition. Treatment may include rest, ice/heat therapy, anti-inflammatory medications, physical therapy, and lifestyle modifications. See a healthcare provider for proper diagnosis and treatment plan.

Heart disease prevention involves lifestyle modifications and risk factor management. Maintain a healthy diet low in saturated fats, exercise regularly (at least 150 minutes per week), avoid smoking, limit alcohol consumption, manage stress, and maintain healthy weight. Regular check-ups to monitor blood pressure, cholesterol, and diabetes are essential. Follow your healthcare provider's recommendations for medications if needed.

input: side effects of blood pressure medication
output: Common side effects of blood pressure medications vary by drug class. ACE inhibitors may cause a dry cough, beta-blockers can cause fatigue or dizziness, diuretics may lead to frequent urination, and calcium channel blockers might cause ankle swelling. Most side effects are mild and temporary. Never stop medications without consulting your healthcare provider, as this can lead to dangerous blood pressure spikes.
important_notes: Report side effects to healthcare provider
